snippet: Thanks to a car-share program, Hoboken, N.J., has seen a slight decrease in the number of residential parking permits, but the effort has not reduced residents’ dependence on cars.
abstract: Corner Cars car-sharing program in Hoboken, NJ, run by Hertz, may be helping ease the city's parking situation, according to survey data; as of July 2012, nearly 25 percent of the program's roughly 3,000 members report that they have given up their cars or decided against buying one because of the car share; since 2009, the number of people with residential parking permits has declined by about 1,000, to 16,000 total permits.
lead_paragraph: Thanks to a car-share program, Hoboken, N.J., has seen a slight decrease in the number of residential parking permits, but the effort has not reduced residents’ dependence on cars.

headline.seo: Car-Sharing Gamble in Hoboken Has Mixed Reactions
headline.main: Data Show a City’s Car Sharing May Be Working, but Doubts Persist
headline.print_headline: Data Show a City’s Car Sharing May Be Working, but Doubts Persist
